item.title: Roby add a quote by Rabbi Abraham Joshua Heschel
item.description: "I have one talent, and that is the capacity to be tremendously surprised, surprised at life, at ideas. This is to me the supreme Hasidic imperative: Don't be old. Don't be stale." -- Rabbi Abraham Joshua Heschel

item.title: Roby add a quote by Catherynne M. Valente
item.description: "The rapt pupil will be forgiven for assuming the Tsar of Death to be wicked and the Tsar of Life to be virtuous. Let the truth be told: There is no virtue anywhere. Life is sly and unscrupulous, a blackguard, wolfish, severe. In service to itself, it will commit any offense. So, too, is Death possessed of infinite strategies and a gaunt nature- but also mercy, also grace and tenderness. In his own country, Death can be kind." -- Catherynne M. Valente

item.title: Roby add a quote by Steven Moffat
item.description:
"Demons run when a good man goes to war Night will fall and drown the sun When a good man goes to war
Friendship dies and true love lies Night will fall and the dark will rise When a good man goes to war
Demons run, but count the cost The battle's won, but the child is lost" -- Steven Moffat
